title: Swiss Ski Resort Fire: Why People Are Asking Questions
summary: A big fire happened at a bar in Crans-Montana, a ski resort in Switzerland, on New Year's Eve. Many young people were hurt or died. People are sad and angry because they found out the bar had not been checked for fire safety since 2019. In Switzerland, local mayors like Nicolas Feraud are supposed to check bars every year to make sure they are safe. But Mayor Feraud said only 40 out of 128 bars in Crans-Montana were checked in 2025. He said there were not enough inspectors to do all the checks. Other mayors in the area, like Romy Biner from Zermatt, also said they do not have enough resources. Swiss journalists asked if the mayor knew the bar owners well or if there was corruption, but he said no. A mother whose sons survived wants clear answers. People are wondering if the Swiss government system, where local officials make decisions, is working properly after this fire.

background_read: Switzerland is a country in Europe known for its mountains and ski resorts. It has a government system where local towns and villages make their own rules with elected officials like mayors. This is called a devolved system, which means decisions are made close to home. Fire safety checks are important to prevent accidents in places like bars where many people gather. After a fire, people often ask questions to understand what went wrong and how to make things safer in the future.
Article_Structure: WHO: Mayor Nicolas Feraud and other local officials in Crans-Montana and Zermatt, Swiss journalists, and a mother whose sons survived the fire.
WHAT: A fire at a bar in Crans-Montana killed and injured many young people, and it was found that the bar had not been inspected for fire safety since 2019.
WHERE: Crans-Montana, a ski resort in the Swiss canton of Valais.
WHY: People are questioning if the Swiss government system, where local officials are responsible for safety checks, is effective, especially since mayors said there were not enough inspectors.

perspectives.description: Mayors like Nicolas Feraud and Romy Biner say they do not have enough resources or inspectors to check all bars regularly, which might explain why safety checks were missed.
Swiss citizens and journalists are angry and suspicious, asking if corruption or personal connections led to the lack of inspections, and they want transparency and accountability.
